content.rendered:
Storefrontin’ (Photo by Lance Anderson on Unsplash)

A new storefront theme from StudioPress to sell all your things, 13 StudioPress themes get updates, plus how to make an animated hamburger menu in Genesis.

Themes

StudioPress launch a sharp new storefront theme, Outfitter Pro (demo). Designed by Lauren Mancke, it’s built to work with WooCommerce right out of the gate.

Introducing Outfitter Pro—a striking new storefront theme for Genesis —> https://t.co/YW0ulWP1J8 #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/YGgeBbIUdA

— StudioPress (@studiopress) August 31, 2017

Plus, Jodi Stammer and Sridhar Katakam report that 13 StudioPress child themes were updated this week.

13 #GenesisWP child themes were updated yesterday/today.https://t.co/0Jbhu8wC2i

via @jstammer

Changes can be seen in README.txt inside.

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) August 30, 2017

I only checked two themes quickly but it looks like mainly WooCommerce related improvements.

Showcase

Nice clean site from Kevin Donnigan for firehawkskids.com

New #wordpress #genesiswp website- #CrossFit Kids & Teens at CrossFit Hellbox from @anythinggraphic with @luckytamm https://t.co/z8PPCnaTRb pic.twitter.com/i7Sj9vpuoA

— Kevin Donnigan (@anythinggraphic) August 30, 2017

Solid site on the Aspire theme by Ruby Slipper Designs for womensleadershipconference.net

Wow! Check out this amazing site @rubyslipperweb built with the Aspire Theme! https://t.co/yTAMrut1Ak#genesiswp #wordpress pic.twitter.com/vYlfoWjs0R

— appfinite (@appfinite) August 30, 2017

Tutorials

Jackie D’Elia demonstrates how to add SVG icons and graphics to your WordPress theme.

Adding SVG icons and graphics to your theme

Susan Ramsey shows you how to style the Simple Social Icons plugin.

On the blog today in my #Genesis4Beginners series. How to Style the Simple Social Icons. #GenesisWP #WordPresshttps://t.co/hJ29Ib4NL1 pic.twitter.com/xbBbSgFzla

— Susan Ramsey (@onehappystudio) August 31, 2017

Sridhar Katakam tells you how to make an animated hamburger menu in Genesis.

Animated Hamburger Menu Icon in Genesis:https://t.co/XiWUnbhzdk#GenesisWP pic.twitter.com/LUlyTMtUJB

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) August 28, 2017

Brian Gardner on how to add TypeKit fonts to your Genesis site. (Plus, he also shares the news that you can now apparently do this with CSS only, no JavaScript).

Quick Tip: How to Add Typekit Fonts to Your Genesis Website —> https://t.co/HjA7fR5qmm #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/eeXWHyBUcm

— StudioPress (@studiopress) September 1, 2017

—

That’s all for this week. Got something awesome to share? Add it to the site. Enjoy these weekly updates? Subscribe below (and never miss another edition again).
